headline: Make-Ahead Sweet Potato Casserole
description: No need to stress about cooking another dish on Thanksgiving. With this easy Make-Ahead Sweet Potato Casserole recipe in your holiday cookbook, you've got the perfect side for any crowd.
name: Make-Ahead Sweet Potato Casserole
recipeIngredient: 4 pounds sweet potatoes, peeled and chopped (12 cups)
1 cup packed light brown sugar, divided
1.5 cups (12 oz.) salted butter, cubed and divided
1.5 cups uncooked old-fashioned regular rolled oats

recipeInstructions.text: Boil and mash sweet potatoes: Preheat oven to 375°F. Place sweet potatoes and water in a large saucepan; bring to a boil over high. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until sweet potatoes are very tender, about 25 minutes. Drain. Return sweet potatoes to pan; mash using a masher to desired consistency.

Make casserole filling: Whisk together eggs, cream, 1/4 cup of the sugar, and 2 teaspoons of the salt in a medium bowl. Whisk in 2 cups of the mashed sweet potatoes 1/2 cup at a time. Add mixture to remaining mashed sweet potatoes in pan; stir until well combined. Add 1/2 cup of the butter, stirring until melted.
Add filling to dish: Transfer mixture to a 13- x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.

Make topping: Stir together oats, flour, cinnamon, and remaining 3/4 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl. Add remaining 1 cup butter; work butter into oat mixture using your fingers until well combined. Sprinkle evenly over casserole in baking dish. (If making ahead of time, cover casserole, and store in refrigerator up to 4 days.)
Bake casserole: Bake in preheated oven until top is browned, 50 to 55 minutes. Let stand at room temperature 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Many ingredients (eggs, flour, cream, etc.) have no amount. I had to guess half way through the recipe. We’ll see how it turns out...

mainEntity.name: Are sweet potatoes the same as yams?

acceptedAnswer.text: Sweet potatoes and yams are different, in spite of their names often being used interchangeably. True yams have a dark, bark-like skin, and more starchy texture, while sweet potatoes have thin skins, and cook up moist and tender.

mainEntity.name: Why does sweet potato casserole become watery?

acceptedAnswer.text: Make sure to drain your boiled sweet potatoes thoroughly to avoid excess liquid that could cause a watery filling.

mainEntity.name: Do you need to add eggs to sweet potato casserole?

acceptedAnswer.text: While you could technically skip the eggs in sweet potato casserole, the filling would not be as light and fluffy, or as perfectly set for scooping.

mainEntity.name: Can I make this sweet potato casserole gluten-free?

acceptedAnswer.text: Swap the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free flour blend or oat flour for a gluten-free version of this casserole.
